summary: The previously blocking Sprint 4 vs zero-tolerance naming gate deadlock is now explicitly reconciled in the plan and validator design, and no new truly blocking issues were introduced.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Sprint 4 ECONOMICS.md pre-flight cites old/forbidden `themes/sietch/src/packages/core/protocol/arrakis-conservation.ts` path, conflicting with naming policy
previous_issues_status.notes: The plan now makes the exemption explicit and testable: RTFM validator check #2 must strip `<!-- cite: ... -->` blocks before running the `arrakis` grep, and Sprint 4.1 acceptance criteria explicitly allow `arrakis-*` only inside cite blocks while still requiring zero 'Arrakis' in prose. Sprint 5.1 expands scope to include ECONOMICS/EVENT-PROTOCOL, but because the validator exemption is defined centrally, the gate remains achievable.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Sprint 2.1 ts-morph AST vs Sprint 4.4 note claiming grep-based extractor (plan contradiction)
previous_issues_status.notes: Sprint 2.1 explicitly allows AST or grep with a requirement to document the chosen approach, and Sprint 4.4â€™s coverage note is aligned to the actual grep-based method.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Canonical 14 conservation properties vs freeside enforcing subset (Sprint 4/6/9 inconsistency)
previous_issues_status.notes: Sprint 4.1 establishes loa-hounfour as normative canonical (14) and freeside as implemented coverage; Sprint 6.4 and Sprint 9.1 reinforce this with an explicit coverage ratio note and a required 14-row table.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: RTFM managed-doc scope ownership split/duplicated (GLOSSARY added twice; Sprint 10 dependency mismatch)
previous_issues_status.notes: Sprint 8.3 is the introduction point for adding GLOSSARY.md to MANAGED_DOCS; Sprint 10.1 is verification-only with an explicit 'no redundant additions' criterion.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: verify-routes.sh acceptance criteria unsafe/flaky (HEAD/GET on every route; non-idempotent routes; 405 handling)
previous_issues_status.notes: Sprint 2.4 constrains auth validation to indexed GET routes, uses safe probes for non-GET routes, treats 405 as non-fatal, and forbids bodies on non-idempotent routes.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Sprint 9 BUTTERFREEZONE discovery fields change lacks explicit golden vector/validator policy update
previous_issues_status.notes: Sprint 9.2 requires validator optional-field handling with advisory exit code 2, updates RTFM check #7 to accept 0 or 2, and regenerates/commits golden vectors.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: No explicit bridge/deep review findings closure artifact mapping finding IDs to doc sections/validation evidence
previous_issues_status.notes: Sprint 10.4 defines a closure table artifact with required columns and CLOSED/DEFERRED rules, covering all 13 findings.
